section.title: Installing on GNU/Linux

listitem.para: Download the latest stable release and save it somewhere in your home directory:
From the command-line terminal untar and uncompress the package (typically using the GNU tar program):

section.para: Voila, you have now successfully installed PyPop. To test your installation, run the program and use the sample test files with the following steps:

listitem.para: Change directory into the extracted directory
Now you can run the interactive version of the program, by simply typing ./pypop.sh, at the command line.
PyPop will remember the names of the configuration and population files you used last, and in subsequent runs will provide those as defaults.
Before starting an install on Windows, you must first make sure you have a copy of a zip file extractor such as PowerArchiver or WinZip.
Download the latest stable Windows release and save it in one of your directories or on the Desktop:

Once you have downloaded the file, you should double-click it and if you have correctly installed one of the zip compression utilities, it should open using that zip program. You should then extract the contents of the zip file and put it somewhere sensible. Consult the documentation for your archiving utility for details on how to do this (it should be reasonably self-explanatory).
Once you have the PyPopWin32-&VERSION; directory extracted, open the directory and double-click on the pypop.sh file.
A DOS shell should then open running the program inside it.
